title: Painting

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of oil, gravel, pebbles, and sand on masonite.

description: In 1927, in the spirit of modernist challenges to authority and convention, Joan Miró declared his intent to “assassinate painting” and upend its traditional hierarchies of materials and subject matter. Painting demonstrates Miró’s ongoing search for new artistic materials, including gravel and sand mixed into oil paint, which he applied to Masonite, a rugged support he favored over traditional canvas. Fascinated by the effect of such rough substances, the artist told his dealer not to worry if any materials came loose when the work was exhibited overseas, since it would “make the surface . . . look like an old crumbling wall, which will give great force to the formal expression.”
medium_display: Oil, gravel, pebbles, and sand on Masonite
credit_line: Gift of Florene May Schoenborn and Samuel A. Marx
publication_history:
Georges Duthuit, “Où allez-vous Miró?” Cahiers d’Art, XI, No. 8–10 (1936), p. 266 (ill.).

Clement Greenberg, Joan Miró (New York, 1948) p. 76 (ill.), pl. XXXVI.

The Art Institute of Chicago, Paintings in The Art Institute of Chicago: A Catalogue of the Picture Collection (Chicago, 1961) p.

Jacques Dupin, Joan Miró: Life and Work, translated by Norbert Guterman (New York, 1962), no. 459, p. 533 (ill.).

A. James Speyer and Courtney Graham Donnell, Twentieth-Century European Paintings (Chicago, 1980), p. 56, no. 2G10.

Jacques Dupin, Catalogue Raisonné. Paintings (Argenton-sur-Creuse, 1999).
exhibition_history:
New York, Museum of Modern Art, The School of Paris: Paintings from the Florence May Schoenborn and Samuel A. Marx Collection, November 1, 1965–January 2, 1966, p. 49; traveled to Chicago, Art Institute, February 11–March 27, 1966; St. Louis, City Art Museum, April 26–June 13, 1966; Mexico City, Museo de Arte Moderno, July 2–August 7, 1966; San Francisco, Museum of Art, September 2–October 2, 1966. 

New York, Museum of Modern Art, Joan Miró, October 17, 1993–January 11, 1994, no. 142, pp. 217 (ill.), 411 (ill.).

New York, Museum of Modern Art, Joan Miró: Painting and Anti-Painting 1927–1937, November 1, 2008–January 12, 2009 (plate 107).
provenance_text: Gallerie Pierre, New York, 1936 [Duthuit 1936]. Pierre Matisse Gallery, New York, 1948.  Mr. and Mrs. Samuel A. Marx, Chicago, by 1950.  Gift to Art Institute, 1950.
